item.title: What Is the Firm Foundation? A Structural Description
item.description: At its peak in the middle decades of the 20th century, the Firm Foundation effectively adjudicated doctrinal and ecclesial disputes among the fiercely autonomous congregations making up the fundamentalist wing of the Stone-Campbell Movement known as the Churches of Christ.
